definition: indigo woad root/root of Isatis tinctoria (used in TCM)
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious
blue/indigo plant
surname Lan
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)

sentences.english: Indigowoad root is one of a few well-recognized anti-virus traditional herbs at present time.
sentences.chinese: 板藍根是目前公認的具有抗病毒作用的少數中藥之一。

sentences.english: Conclusion The methods could be used to control the quality of the Radix Isatidis.
sentences.chinese: 結論可利用此方法控制板藍根的質量。

sentences.english: Isatis-Root extract powder is active against virus.
sentences.chinese: 板藍根浸膏粉有抗病毒作用。

sentences.english: Objective To compare the relative content of Indirubin and Indigo of Indigowoad root from different areas.
sentences.chinese: 目的比較不同來源板藍根中靛玉紅與靛藍的相對含量。

sentences.english: OBJECTIVE The bio-active constituents were expected to be obtained from the root of Isatis indigotica Fort.
sentences.chinese: 目的從板藍根中提取分離活性成分。

sentences.english: Objective To discuss pharmacological action and the clinical application of Radix Isatidis.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討板藍根藥理作用與臨牀應用。

sentences.english: Board is Lagen OK and daily drink?
OBJECTIVE To optimize the preparation technology of Radix Isatidis Injection.
sentences.chinese: 目的優選板藍根注射液的製備工藝。

sentences.english: Objective To establish TLC method of nucleoside in the Radix Isatidis.
sentences.chinese: 目的建立板藍根中核苷類薄層色譜鑑別。

sentences.english: Why can't it be sold to the west?
sentences.chinese: 但板藍根爲什麼不能出售給西方呢？

sentences.english: OBJECTIVE:To isolate the chemical constituents from Radix Isatidis.
sentences.chinese: 目的從板藍根中分離化學成分。

sentences.english: Chemical fingerprint chromatographs of hetero-polarity extractions of Radix isatidis were established.
sentences.chinese: 建立板藍根不同極性萃取物的化學指紋圖譜。

poor man's ginseng (Codonopsis pilosula)/codonopsis root (used in TCM)
milk vetch/plant genus Astragalus/huangqi 黃芪|黄芪, Astragalus membranaceus (used in TCM)
dried ginger
herbal plaster applied to a wound
King Solomon's seal (plant of genus Polygonatum)
bacillary dysentery
nice/pleasant
